meanings.sent1: The tenter held the fabric in place on the frame.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used a tenter to ensure the cloth was taut.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the tenter was a fun climbing structure.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a tenter, pulling her in different directions.
meanings.sent5: The tenter creaked as it stretched the fabric, echoing through the room.

meanings.sent1: She had to tenter the elastic band to fit it around the box.
meanings.sent2: The athlete could feel his muscles tenter as he pushed himself to the limit.
meanings.sent3: The old rubber band refused to tenter anymore, snapping with a loud twang.
meanings.sent4: His patience began to tenter as he waited for the delayed train.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room seemed to tenter as the argument escalated.

meanings.definition: A person who tends or looks after something.
meanings.sent1: The garden tenter watered the plants every morning.
meanings.sent2: The zoo tenter fed the animals and cleaned their enclosures.
meanings.sent3: The book tenter made sure all the volumes were neatly arranged on the shelves.
meanings.sent4: She was the tenter of the community garden, ensuring everything grew well.
meanings.sent5: The diligent tenter kept a watchful eye on the flock of sheep.
